feeling that something is as good as it should be, or that something has happened in the way that you want
They have plenty of satisfied customers.
If you’re not completely satisfied, you can get your money back.
I’m not satisfied with the way he cut my hair.
They were not satisfied with the room
They were not satisfied about the room
feeling sure that something is right or true
He was satisfied that he had done nothing wrong.
satisfied.translation[0].note_box[0].sec: feeling that something is as good as it should be, or that something has happened in the way that you want
The teacher is satisfied with his progress.
satisfied. Happy is very commonly used instead of satisfied  in everyday English
The boss seems happy with my work.
I’m happy to work part-time until the kids are older.
He came out looking pleased with himself.
satisfied with what you are doing, so that you do not want to change anything
She seemed content to just sit and watch the others.
Sam was quite content with his life on the farm.
feeling that you have achieved enough in your life, and that you do not need things that are more interesting, important, or useful
I enjoy being a mother, but to feel fulfilled I need to work too.
